messages.message:
For schema auto-gen, it by default generates only a single class.
To generate split-schema, you need to do 4-5 clicks to change split settings to split by documents - then generate.
The setting to change between split settings could be surfaced up or we can flip default to split by documents.
cc @Serena

yeah i noticed this and i think potentially we can display smth like the UI popup that u see when u first classify documents w/ multiple pages where u can choose split classification or classification (and hide split by page):

@ayesha.ali :goodidea: good idea!

@jaden can you add this modal when the autogenerate schema button is clicked?

the modal will need to have different copy though

something like this?

cc @Natasha @melissa.amos
Does anyone use split each page setting? ^ yeah exactly
Can we just enable splitting by default in the background? In the event that you don't want splitting, you can disable it in settings.

@Anil yes people use "split each page"

but i don't think it should be shown when we autogenerate schema
@ayesha.ali wdyt about Melissa's suggestion? would it be ok if we always enable splitting before generating a schema?
Also just for context the split by page option still uses the classification model for autogen schema. Only the split by documents uses split classification model.

imo i think it's a bit confusing if we always split. it's opposite to the default of classification rn and i think the symmetry of asking a user to classify or split classify when manually creating a schema or autogenerating makes sense. additionally just from my observations of auto gen results, for projects/apps that classically use classification, like annual report, the split classification result can be somewhat overwhelming (>7 classes) and unnecessary for the use case, so i think there's no harm in giving the option? but yeah open to thoughts if the idea is that we want the default behavior to change w/ agent mode
^ good callout

I have seen this annual report example.
For now lets add the modal with the two options with a toggle as Serena proposed with reasonable text.
ok i guess we still need your input then - are you ok with my edited screenshot above? @melissa.amos

Just to confirm for the modal, this will be intended specifically for autogen schema so whatever option you select here won't affect the project settings file splitting - it'll only determine which `classification_type` to send back to the BE?
this should change the project settings!

Here's my content rec, but I have questions about it:
• I can't remember how much we've explained classes at this point? Does the schema editor already basically say this first sentence? If so, we can strike it here.
• Please tell me we're showing this _only_ if the project actually includes multipage files?
-----
*Autogenerating schema...*
Schema generation includes identifying document types, or _classes_, in your project. Specify whether multipage files are assigned a single class, or split into separate documents when appropriate.
( o) Split multipage files
Splits multipage files into separate documents based on context.

> • Please tell me we're showing this _only_ if the project actually includes multipage files?
@jaden do you think you can check this before showing this modal?
yes i believe the current enabling classification model checks that. I am just figuring out how to move it to make it also work w autogen.
here is a preview of what it would look like - changing the settings in the modal will also update the project settings.
here is the PR if we need to backport! https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/74585
thanks for putting this up quickly! i don't think this is a blocker for agent mode private preview, though? @Anil @margaret.tomaszczuk to confirm
I don't, no. and +1 nice work Jaden!
